Package Actors

Class Player

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
Actors.MovingImage
Actors.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Player
extends MovingImage
The Player class represents a real life player in the game
Author:
adityapanikkar
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(int x, int y, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String uniqueID, boolean hasBall)
      Instantiates a new Player at (x, y) with username, a unique identifier, and a boolean that is true if the player possesses the ball or not
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the player
      y - Y-coordinate of the player
      username - Name of each player
      uniqueID - The unique identifier of each player
      hasBall - True if player has ball and false if not

  • Method Details

    • spawnPowerup

      public void spawnPowerup()
      Randomly spawns one of two possible powerups
      Postcondition:
      Spawns a new random power up and player's speed or jump height is increased

    • getPower

      public boolean getPower()
      Checks to see if the player currently has a powerup or does not
      Returns:
      True if the powerup is on or false if not

    • powerOff

      public void powerOff()
      Turns power up off when the timer ends
      Postcondition:
      The power up is turned off

    • updateState

      public void updateState​(int count)
      Changes the energy state
      Parameters:
      count - What the energy state should be changed too
      Postcondition:
      Energy state is updated

    • regenerate

      public void regenerate()
      The player fully regenerates it's energy
      Postcondition:
      Energy is updated

    • dash

      public void dash​(Ball ball)
      Makes player dash
      Postcondition:
      Dash is true and energy is decreased

    • getDirection

      public boolean getDirection()
      Find and returns direction player is facing
      Returns:
      True if facing right, false if facing left

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(boolean dir)
      Sets the direction the player is facing
      Parameters:
      dir - Direction to be set, true if right and false if left
      Postcondition:
      Direction of player is updated

    • walk

      public void walk​(int dir)
      This method represents the person taking a step and also includes the implementation of powerups
      Parameters:
      dir - the magnitude of the step distance
      Postcondition:
      X, Y, xvelocity, and yvelocity are updated according to actions executed

    • jump

      public void jump()
      This method represents the person jumping. it also accounts for the jump powerup
      Postcondition:
      Y velocity of the player is updated

    • act

      public void act​(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Shape> obstacles, Player player2)
      This method represents the player acting and is called each time the game cycles
      Parameters:
      obstacles - A list containing shapes representing obstacles in the game
      player2 - Player in the game
      Postcondition:
      X, Y, and velocities are updated according to actions executed

    • getDataObject

      public PlayerData getDataObject()

      Returns:
      PlayerData object containing data

    • syncWithDataObject

      public void syncWithDataObject​(PlayerData data)
      Syncs the player with the player data object
      Parameters:
      data - Object containing player data
      Postcondition:
      Player is updated and synced with player data given

      Returns:
      True if it is a match, false if otherwise
